intro: Horichia, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have palmate or trifoliate leaves and produce showy, often yellow or white flowers. Horichia species are generally herbaceous and can be found in woodland or moist meadow habitats. They are noted for their ornamental value and have been used in traditional herbal medicine.
